page.title: 10TYPICAL EGMANTON FARMS (2)
page.content: A typical pig-rearing farm is Yew Tree Farm, Egmanton. This has been operating for 26 years and supports one family with 12 acres of land. There are 500 pigs and 12 cattle, of the 500 pigs 78 are breeding sows and there are 3 boars. The pigs are housed in brick and concrete buildings and coverad yards and are dry fed on cereals in meal form and purchased proteins and minerals, with a separate water supply. Farm machinery here consists of tractors, loaders etc., associated with a livestock unit. The labour force consists of the owner and one young employee.
